code:
# @param {Integer[]} nums
# @return {Integer}
def minimum_sum(nums)
    left_min = Array.new(nums.length, Float::INFINITY)
    right_min = Array.new(nums.length, Float::INFINITY)
    min_sum = Float::INFINITY
    
    # Fill left_min with minimum values from left up to each index
    min_val = Float::INFINITY
    nums.each_with_index do |num, i|
        min_val = [min_val, num].min
        left_min[i] = min_val
    end
    
    # Fill right_min with minimum values from right up to each index
    min_val = Float::INFINITY
    nums.reverse.each_with_index do |num, i|
        min_val = [min_val, num].min
        right_min[nums.length - 1 - i] = min_val
    end
    
    # Check for mountain triplets and calculate their sum
    nums.each_with_index do |num, j|
        if left_min[j] < num && right_min[j] < num
            sum = left_min[j] + num + right_min[j]
            min_sum = [min_sum, sum].min
        end
    end
    
    min_sum == Float::INFINITY ? -1 : min_sum
end
